responsibility.quote: Doing something unimportant well does not make it important

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: It isn’t enough to think outside the box. Thinking is passive. Get used to acting outside the box

responsibility.quote: My definition of luxury has changed over time. Now, it’s not about owning a lot of stuff. Luxury, to me, is feeling unrushed

responsibility.quote: Emergencies are seldom that
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Different is better when it is more effective or more fun
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The world is changed by your example, not by your opinion
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you let pride stop you, you will hate life
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Too much, too many, and too often of what you want becomes what you don’t want
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The objective is to control your time – a non-renewable resource – and apply it where you have the highest leverage or enjoyment
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: The best results I have had in my life; the most enjoyable times, have all come from asking the simple question: What is the worst that could happen?
If you are insecure, guess what? The rest of the world is, too. Do not overestimate the competition and underestimate yourself. You are better than you think
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Success can usually be measured by the number of uncomfortable conversations we are willing to have, and by the number of uncomfortable actions we are willing to take
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: There is just less competition for bigger goals
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: The question you should be asking isn’t, "What do I want?" or "What are my goals?" but "What would excite me?"

It’s lonely at the top. Ninety-nine percent of people in the world are convinced they are incapable of achieving great things, so they aim for the mediocre. The level of competition is thus fiercest for ‘realistic’ goals, paradoxically making them the most time and energy-consuming
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The 80-hour-per-week, 500 000$-per-year investment banker is less "powerful" than the employed New Rich who works 1/4 the hours for 40 000$, but has complete freedom of when, where, and how to live
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Give vulnerability a shot. Give discomfort its due. Because I think he or she who is willing to be the most uncomfortable is not only the bravest, but rises the fastest
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Focus on being productive instead of busy
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: You are the average of the five people you associate with most, so do not underestimate the effects of your pessimistic, unambitious, or disorganized friends. If someone isn’t making you stronger, they’re making you weaker
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What are the worst things that could happen?
There has never been a better time for testing the uncommon
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The bottom line is that you only have the rights you fight for
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Stop wishing and start doing
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Being busy is a form of laziness – lazy thinking and indiscriminate action
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Most people will choose unhappiness over uncertainty
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Simple works, complex fails
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Don’t suffer fools or you’ll become one
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Keep it simple. Complicated answers are rarely the right answers
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: 10x results don’t always require 10x effort
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Remember, boredom is the enemy, not some abstract "failure"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Competition makes you better
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I’m in it for the long haul; the adventure continues
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Never, ever give up
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Age doesn’t matter: an open mind does
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Everyone struggles. Take solace in that
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you don’t have time, you don’t have priorities
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: It’s not what you know. It’s what you do consistently
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Focus, get the critical few done, and get out
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Big things are coming
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Take it easy, ya azizi
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: To have more quality and less clutter. (The goal of wise people or, "New Rich" as Tim Ferris puts it)
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Emphasize strengths, don’t fix weaknesses
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The gems I’ve found were forged in the struggle
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Tomorrow becomes never. No matter how small the task, take the first step now
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Just because it’s labeled "impossible" doesn’t make it even remotely impossible
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The worst that could happen wasn’t crashing and burning, it was accepting terminal boredom as a tolerable status quo
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: You are the author of your own life, and it’s never too late to replace the stories you tell yourself and the world
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: Instead of thinking of the repercussions of an action, you should also be asking yourself, ‘what are the costs of inaction?’
Think big and don’t listen to people who tell you it can’t be done. Life’s too short to think small
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Even a small amount of non-reactive planning and reflection will completely separate you from everyone else, because you are avoiding the impulse and social pressure to multitask
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: It is possible to become world-class, enter the top 5% of performers in the world, in almost any subject within 6-12 months, or even 6-12 weeks
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If I want a better-than-average career, I can’t simply ‘go with the flow’ and get it. Most people do just that: they wish for an outcome but make no intention-driven actions toward that outcome. If they would just do something most people would find that they get some version of the outcome they’re looking for. That’s been my secret. Stop wishing and start doing
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Realistic goals, goals restricted to the average ambition level, are uninspiring and will only fuel you through the first or second problem, at which point you throw in the towel. If the potential payoff is mediocre or average, so is your effort
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What are you good at? What could you be the best at? What makes you happy? What excites you? What makes you feel accomplished and good about yourself? What are you most proud of having accomplished in your life? Can you repeat this or further develop it? What do you enjoy sharing or experiencing with other people?
It is predicated on the assumption that you dislike what you are doing during the most physically capable years of your life. This is a nonstarter—nothing can justify that sacrifice
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Most "superheroes" are nothing of the sort. They’re weird, neurotic creatures who do big things despite lots of self-defeating habits and self-talk
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The most fulfilled and effective people I know – world-famous creatives, billionaires, thought leaders, and more – look at their life’s journey as perhaps 25 percent finding themselves and 75 percent creating themselves
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: When you try to do something big it’s hard to fail completely
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: To become "successful," you have to say "yes" to a lot of experiments. To learn what you’re best at, or what you’re most passionate about, you have to throw a lot against the wall
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I encourage you to make huge, ambitious plans. Just remember that the big-beyond-belief things are accomplished when you deconstruct them into the smallest possible pieces and focus on each "moment of impact", one step at the time
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: We end up spending (as Thoreau put it) "the best part of one’s life earning money in order to enjoy a questionable liberty during the least valuable part of it." We’d love to drop all and explore the world outside, we tell ourselves, but the time never seems right. Thus, given an unlimited amount of choices, we make none. Settling into our lives, we get so obsessed with holding on to our domestic certainties that we forget why we desired them in the first place"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: You develop confidence through action, and you have to have courage first.
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: In a world where nobody really knows anything, you have the incredible freedom to continually reinvest yourself and forge new paths, no matter how strange. Embrace your weird self
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: For a long time, I’ve known that the key to getting started down the path of being remarkable in anything is to simply act with the intention of being remarkable
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Focus on what’s in front of you, design great days to create a great life, and try not to make the same mistake twice
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Three to five billion new consumers are coming online in the next 6 years. Holy cow, that’s extraordinary
responsibility.author: What do they need?

responsibility.quote: Don’t use skepticism as a thinly veiled excuse for inaction or remaining in your comfort zone
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Find the cause or vehicle that interests you most and make no apologies
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Just because you exercise doesn’t mean you deserve sugar water
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you hate shrimp, don’t eat the goddamn shrimp
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I’m eight days into fasting so if I sound like an idiot I’m gonna blame it on that
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Derek Sivers)

responsibility.quote: Audio engineers will never be fully satisfied with your audio, but 99.9% of listeners will be happy if you’re intelligible and loud enough
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Look for the optimal dose of any activity. Too little sun, you don’t get a tan. Just enough, you get a tan. Too much, you get burned
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you have a strong informed opinion, don’t keep it to yourself. Try to help people and make the world a better place. If you strive to do anything remotely interesting, just expect a small percentage of the population to always find a way to take it personally. F*ck ’em. There are no statues erected to critics
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If someone ends up better than me (or ranking better than me), they deserve to beat me. I’ll be the first person to buy them a beer
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you’re half-assing it and coasting, find something else you can whole-ass
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I mean, like, rice cakes? Might as well just inject yourself with insulin
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The way that you become world-class is by asking good questions.
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: "What do you want?" is too imprecise to produce a meaningful and actionable answer
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: While the world is a gold mine, you need to go digging in other people’s heads to unearth riches. Questions are your pickaxes and competitive advantage
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: How can you use different belief systems, different frameworks, different principles, different tech tools to optimize your productivity and your effectiveness?

It all starts with the right questions. If you get the answers right to the wrong questions, you won’t get very far, whereas if you get even mediocre answers to the right questions, then those are the force multipliers
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: How do you generate the most profit with the least effort? How do you maximize margins without sacrificing quality?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What would I do/have/be if I had $10 million?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What’s the least crowded channel?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: If I could only work 2 hours per week on my business, what would I do?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What if I did the opposite for 48 hours?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: Could I create a product that would scratch my own itch?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What might I put in place to allow me to go off the grid for 4 to 8 weeks, with no phone or email?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: Which one of these, if done, would render all the rest either easier or completely irrelevant?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What if I let them make decisions up to $100? $500? $1,000?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What would this look like if it were easy?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What if I couldn’t pitch my product directly?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What if I created my own real-world MBA?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: Do I need to make it back the way I lost it?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: Could it be that everything is fine and complete as is?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: If not now, when? If left at the status quo, what will your life and stress look like in six months? In one year? In three years? Who around you will also suffer?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: In the midst of overwhelm, is life not showing me exactly what I should subtract?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: How can I throw money at this problem? How can I "waste" money to improve the quality of my life?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What if I could only subtract to solve problems?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: Am I having a breakdown or a breakthrough?
Being efficient without regard to effectiveness is the default mode of the universe
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: There is no one right answer. Only better questions.
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If the answer isn’t simple, it’s probably not the right answer
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The most common approach is very seldom the most effective and most efficient
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The options are limitless, but each path must begin with the same first step: replacing assumptions
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: When you put on really effective armor, you do keep things out but you also keep a lot in
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Outside of the law and science and even within science and within law, reality is kinda negotiable. So I mean, a good example of that is the high jump, the fosbury flop. Dick Fosbury was really the first guy to go backward over the high jump and up to that point, there’s been the straddle kick, and all sorts of different approaches. He was ridiculed at first and then he was called a cheat because he won the gold medal and now everybody uses that approach
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: Everyone is fighting a battle you know nothing about
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Very often, "our" beliefs are not our own
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Achievement without appreciation makes you ambitious but miserable. Appreciation without achievement makes you unambitious but happy
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Improving the quality of life in the world is in no fashion inferior to adding more lives
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Many of our strengths in excess become or create glaring weaknesses
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The best results in life are often held back by false constructs and untested assumptions
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The commonsense rules of the ‘real world’ are a fragile collection of socially reinforced illusions
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Babe Ruth struck out all the time, but he’s not remembered for that. He’s remembered for what worked
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If the recipe sucks, it doesn’t matter how good a cook you are
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: You’re never as bad as they say you are, but you’re never as good as they say you are either
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Most people are fast to stop you before you get started but hesitant to get in the way if you’re moving
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The goal is to find your inefficiencies in order to eliminate them and to find your strengths so you can multiply them
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Slow down and remember this: Most things make no difference. Being busy is a form of mental laziness – lazy thinking and indiscriminate action
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Time is wasted because there is so much time available
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Never automate something that can be eliminated, and never delegate something that can be automated or streamlined. Otherwise, you waste someone else’s time instead of your own, which now wastes your hard-earned cash
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: "Someday" is a disease that will take your dreams to the grave with you
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Don’t confuse the complex with the difficult. Most situations are simple — many are just emotionally difficult to act upon
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The fishing is best where the fewest go and the collective insecurity of the world makes it easy for people to hit home runs while everyone is aiming for base hits
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Look for flexible principles so that you can then have a toolkit that’s adaptable
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Most of the time, "What should I do with my life?" is a terrible question
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I believe that life exists to be enjoyed, and that the most important thing is to feel good about yourself
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: To enjoy life, you don’t need fancy nonsense, but you do need to control your time and realize that most things just aren’t as serious as you make them out to be
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: To feel more at peace and more successful, you don’t need genius-level brain power, access to some secret society, or to his a moving target of "just" and additional X dollars. Those are all distractions
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you make yourself laugh every once in a while, at least you will have fun. And that is perhaps the best strategy of all
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you want confusion and heartache, ask vague questions. If you want uncommon clarity and results, ask uncommonly clear questions
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Service isn’t limited to saving lives or the environment. It can also improve life. If you are a musician and put a smile on the faces of thousands or millions, I view that as service. If you are a mentor and change the life of one child for the better, the world has been improved
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: To dramitically change your life, you don’t need to run a 100-mile race, get a PhD, or completely reinvest yourself. It’s the small things, done consistently, that are the big things
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: Does your life have a purpose? Are you contributing anything useful to this world, or just shuffling papers, banging on a keyboard, and coming home to a drunken existence on the weekends?
If we’re serious all the time, we’ll wear out before we get the truly serious stuff done
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: This is something that is – being true to oneself – I think that most people struggle with
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: To have an uncommon lifestyle you need to develop the uncommon habit of making decisions, both for yourself and for others
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The tricky thing about life is, on the one hand having the courage to enter into things that are unfamiliar, but also having the wisdom to stop exploring when you’ve found something worth sticking around for. That is true of a place, of a person, of a vocation. Balancing those two things—the courage of exploring and the commitment to staying – and getting the ratio right is very hard. I think my 70-year-old self would say: ‘Be careful that you don’t err on one side or the other, because you have an ill-conceived idea of who you are
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: For all of the most important things, the timing always sucks. Waiting for a good time to quit your job? The stars will never align and the traffic lights of life will never all be green at the same time. The universe doesn’t conspire against you, but it doesn’t go out of its way to line up the pins either. Conditions are never perfect
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If it’s important to you and you want to do it "eventually," just do it and correct course along the way
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Learn to be difficult when it counts. In school as in life, having a reputation for being assertive will help you receive preferential treatment without having to beg or fight for it every time
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: It’s far more lucrative and fun to leverage your strengths instead of attempting to fix all the chinks in your armor
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: To the pregnant void of infinite possibilities, only possible with a lack of obligation, or at least, no compulsive reactivity
responsibility.author: Perhaps this is only possible with the negative space to – as Kurt Vonnegut put it – "fart around"? To do things for the hell of it? For no damn good reason at all?

responsibility.quote: You don’t need to go through life huffing and puffing, straining and red-faced. You can get 95% of the results you want by calmly putting one foot in front of the other
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: For all their bitching about what’s holding them back, most people have a lot of trouble coming up with the defined dreams they’re being held from
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Often, all that stands between you and what you want is a better set of questions
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The opposite of love is indifference, and the opposite of happiness is – here’s the clincher – boredom
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Excitement is the more practical synonym for happiness, and it is precisely what you should strive to chase. It is the cure-all
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I’m often asked how I define "success." It’s an overused term, but I fundamentally view this elusive beast as a combination of two things – achievement and appreciation
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: On the Jar Of Awesome: There is a mason jar on my kitchen counter with JAR OF AWESOME in glitter letters on the side. Anything something really cool happens in a day, something that made me excited or joyful, doctor’s orders are to write it down on a slip of paper and put it in this mason jar
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: On the Jar Of Awesome: When something great happens, you think you’ll remember it 3 months later, but you won’t
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: On the Jar Of Awesome: Cultivate the habtis of putting something in every day. Can’t think of anything? "I didn’t die today!" is a reliable winner
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The key to not feeling rushed is remembering that lack of time is actually lack of priorities
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I leaned against the wall and slid down until I was sitting on the floor. I closed my eyes, smiled, and took a deep breath. Things were about to change. Everything was about to change
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you don’t regularly appreciate the small wins, you will never appreciate the big wins. They’ll all fall through your fingers like sand as you obsess on the next week, the next to-do, the next thing to fix
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Friction points and single points of failure happen in any given day potentially, so think in a concise, intelligent way
responsibility.author: Out of five items to do, which one would make you satisfied with your entire day?

responsibility.quote: The question no one really seemed to be answering was: ‘Why do it all in the first place? What’s the pot of gold that justifies spending the best years of you life hoping for happiness in the last?’
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Look for the good, practice finding the good, and you’ll see it more often
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: For anything approaching happiness, you have to want what you already have
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Rule 1. Instead of fixating on the often nebulous "brand," think of how you can "own a category" in the minds of 1000 die-hard fans who can then act as your strongest marketing force
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you can’t be No. 1 or No. 2 in a category ("Uber for X," imported light beer, low-cost airline, whatever), find or create another category
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Rule 2. Don’t make a product for "everyone"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If everyone is your market, no one is your market. Particularly with the first versions of your product or service, it’s better to have 1,000 people who love you (and many who hate you) than 100,000 who think you’re kinda, sorta cool. "Great" to 1,000 edge-case nerds beats "good" to 100,000 of anything else, every time. In a social-sharing-driven world, cultivate the intense few instead of the lukewarm many
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Rule 3. Forget branding. Think about consistently over-delivering one or two benefits to your customers/users/fans
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Branding is a side effect of consistent association. Don’t put the cart before the horse. Put good business first, and good "brand" will follow
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The secret to winning any game lies in not trying too hard
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Marketing can grab customers, but product multiplies them
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Marketing to me means to identify exactly who your ideal customer is: knowing their behavior, knowing their age, knowing their gender, knowing their location. And 9 times out of 10, in my opinion, the easiest way to do that is to just sell to people who are as similar to you as possible
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Clever marketing and PR stunts can get customers… but only for so long. It’s the product that will create long-term word-of-mouth and the groundswell needed for a global phenomenon
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The easiest way to distinguish yourself is to ask yourself how you can be different, and not just better.
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Step 1 on the best 3-5 ways to secure first clients: The best way to quickly build a services business, or any business – especially since you have income from your full-time job – is to "buy" your first clients. This means that you offer your services for free, or at a massively discounted rate (or for a temporary free "trial/test" period), to clients who would make excellent and impressive testimonials. The key here is that your cost-to-value-delivered ratio must be clearly better than anything else they use
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Step 2: Once you have testimonials or referrals from 3-5 marquee clients, you’ll be in great shape to charge others full retail. I’ve done this in multiple fields, whether teaching accelerated learning, selling massive data storage systems, angel investing in tech (i.e. investing a tiny amount, so I own a tiny piece of equity, but putting in a lot of sweat and labor), or podcast advertising
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The best entrepreneurs I’ve ever met are all good communicators. It’s perhaps one of the very few unifying factors
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Learn the art of the pitch and of messaging
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I think there’s always a market for quality
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I’m really excited about the future of content marketing. But in the same fashion that you have Google, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon – who all used to be very cleanly separate – on this collision course where they are competing on the same verticals, I think you’re going to end up having television producers, movie producers, writers, song writers, all competing for the same mental bandwidth
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: That 1000 true fans will lead to a cascading effect. The 10 million that don’t get it don’t matter
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you only have time to read one article on marketing, make it 1,000 True Fans by Kevin Kelly, founding editor of Wired Magazine
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The customer is not always right. "Fire" high-maintenance customers
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Deadlines over details. […] Perfect products delivered past deadline kill companies. Better to have a good-enough product delivered on-time
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I want to convert casual listeners into die-hard, fervent listeners, and I want to convert casual sponsors into die-hard, fervent sponsors. This requires two things: 1) Playing the long game, and 2) Strategically leaving some chips on the table. As a mentor once told me, "You can shear a sheep many times, but you can skin him only once"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: An entrepreneur isn’t someone who owns a business, it’s someone who makes things happen
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: All of my biggest wins have come from leveraging strengths instead of fixing weaknesses
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Niche is the new big
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: It’s much more interesting to me to sell something like a small-scale, $10,000-per-seat seminar every 2-3 years, instead of obsessing over monthly, weekly, or even daily Amazon commissions, for instance
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Who you portray in your marketing isn’t necessarily the only demographic who buys your product — it’s often the demographic that most people aspire to. The target isn’t the market
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: "General fame is overrated. You want to be famous to 2,000 to 3,000 people you handpick." I’m paraphrasing, but the gist is that you don’t need or want mainstream fame. It brings more liabilities than benefits. However, if you’re known and respected by 2–3K high-caliber people (e.g., the live TED audience), you can do anything and everything you want in life. It provides maximal upside and minimal downside
responsibility.author: (Tools Of Titans, Eric Weinstein)

responsibility.quote: Broadly speaking, as good as it feels to have a plan, it’s even more freeing to realize that nearly no misstep can destroy you. This gives you the courage to improvise and experiment
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Good stories always beat good spreadsheets. Whether you are raising money, pitching your product to customers, selling the company, or recruiting employees, never forget that underneath all the math and the MBA bullshit talk, we are all still emotionally driven human beings. We want to attach ourselves to narratives
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: We don’t act because of equations. We follow our beliefs. We get behind leaders who stir our feelings. In the early days of your venture, if you find someone diving too deep into the numbers, that means they are struggling to find a reason to deeply care about you
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: First get the crowd, then sell the product
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: There are people I have outsourced to in India who now outsource portions of their work to the Philippines. It’s the efficient use of capital, and if you want the rewards of a free market, if you want to enjoy the rewards of the capitalist system, these are the rules by which you play
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Being able to quit things that don’t work is integral to being a winner
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you take a strong stance and have a clear opinion or statement on any subject online, you’re going to polarize people. And without that polarity, there’s no discussion. Discussion is what I want, which means that I’m fine with the consequences
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: What we really need to do, to design, is look at the extremes. The weakest, or the person with arthritis, or the athlete, or the strongest, the fastest person, because if we understand what the extremes are, the middle will take care of itself." In other words, the extremes inform the mean, but not vice versa
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I think the ‘soft sell’ is very undervalued
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I still feel there are much smarter self-promoters out there than me. I am very methodical about my messaging, and I know how to gain attention very quickly
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Everything that works in sales has been done already. Just keep track of the crap that you buy, or the awesome stuff that you buy, and decide what was the trigger, and then just sell to people like you. It’s really that easy – and that’s what I do
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Famous tech blogger Robert Scoble later described my intricate marketing plan as "get drunk with bloggers." It worked surprisingly well
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: People don’t like being sold products, but we all like being told stories
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Enough is enough. Lemmings no more. The blind quest for cash is a fool’s errand
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you can free your time and location, your money is automatically worth 3-10 times as much
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The majority of my finances come from early-stage startup investing
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: For me, money is not a prime motivator. It’s one criterion that I can use to filter out opportunities. My high is the eureka moment when I find, or I am taught, a non-obvious way of solving a problem
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Where can you trade money for time? Where can you spend money that creates more time tomorrow or next week? That is almost always a good investment
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: 1 000 000$ in the bank isn’t the fantasy. The fantasy is the lifestyle of complete freedom it supposedly allows
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Being financially rich and having the ability to live like a millionaire are fundamentally two very different things
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Money is multiplied in practical value depending on the number of W’s you control in your life: what do you, when you do it, where you do it, and with whom you do it. I call this the "freedom multiplier"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I’m not averse to making a lot of money. But where does that end? I hang out with people with hundreds of millions of dollars. Is that the standard by which I should measure myself? Where does that take you if you’re in my business? I think it takes you to pretty dark, corrupt places
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I have plenty of money to do what I want to do, and I have the relationships
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Your network is your net worth
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: In the beginning of your career, you spend time to earn money. Once you hit your stride in any capacity, you should spend money to earn time, as the latter is nonrenewable
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you find yourself saying, "But I’m making so much money" about a job or project, pay attention. "But I’m making so much money," or "But I’m making good money" is a warning sign that you’re probably not on the right track or, at least, that you shouldn’t stay there for long. Money can always be regenerated. Time and reputation cannot
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: "If only I had more money" is the easiest way to postpone the intense self-examination and decision-making necessary to create a life of enjoyment- now and not later. By using money as the scapegoat and work as our all-consuming routine, we are able to conveniently disallow ourselves the time to do otherwise"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Money doesn’t change you; it reveals who you are when you no longer have to be nice
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The more we associate experience with cash value, the more we think that money is what we need to live. And the more we associate money with life, the more we convince ourselves that we’re too poor to buy our freedom
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The goal of "investing" has always been simple: to allocate resources (e.g. money, time, energy) to improve quality of life
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I am willing to accept a mild and temporary 10% decrease in current quality of life (based on morale in journaling) for a high-probability 10x return, whether the ROI comes in the form of cash, time, energy, or otherwise
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: People don’t want to be millionaires — they want to experience what they believe only millions can buy
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: An investment that produces a massive financial ROI but makes me a complete nervous mess, or causes insomnia and temper tantrums for a long period of time, is NOT a good investment
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I don’t typically invest in public stocks for this reason, even when I know I’m leaving cash on the table. My stomach can’t take the ups and downs, but—like drivers rubbernecking to look at a wreck—I seem incapable of not looking. I will compulsively check Google News and Google Finance, despite knowing it’s self-sabotage
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: A large guaranteed decrease in present quality of life doesn’t justify a large speculative return
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: One could argue that I should work on my reactivity instead of avoiding stocks. I’d agree on tempering reactivity, but I’d disagree on fixing weaknesses as a primary investment (or life) strategy
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I get 50-100 pitches per week. This creates an inbox problem. […] I’ve had to declare email bankruptcy twice in the last six months. It’s totally untenable
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: From 2008 to 2009, I began to ask myself, "What if I could only subtract to solve problems?" when advising startups. Instead of answering, "What should we do?" I tried first to hone in on answering, "What should we simplify?"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I don’t want to hire staff for vetting, so I’ve concluded I must ignore all new startup pitches and intros
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I’m tired of unwarranted last-minute "hurry up and sign" emergencies and related fire drills. It’s a culture of cortisol
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I’m in startups for the long game. In some capacity, I plan to be doing this 20+ years from now
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Most of my best investments were made during the "Dot-com Depression" of 2008-2009 (e.g. Uber, Shopify, Twitter, etc.), when only the hardcore remained standing on a battlefield littered with startup bodies
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: To get rich beyond your wildest dreams in startup investing, it isn’t remotely necessary to bet on a Facebook or Airbnb every year
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: People are least productive in reactive mode
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: If this were the only thing I accomplished today, would I be satisfied with my day?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: Will moving this forward make all the other to-do’s unimportant or easier to knock off later?

It’s often what you do, not how you do it, that is the determining factor. This is the difference from being effective; doing the right things, and being efficient; doing things well whether they are important
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: "Not-to-do" lists are often more effective than to-do lists for upgrading performance
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Block out at 2-3 hours to focus on one of them for today. Let the rest of the urgent but less important stuff slide. It will still be there tomorrow
responsibility.author: (For more detail, check out this article by Tim Ferriss)

responsibility.quote: If you get distracted or start procrastinating, don’t freak out and downward spiral; just gently come back to your ONE to-do
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If I have 10 important things to do in a day, it’s 100% certain nothing important will get done that day
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: It doesn’t take much to seem superhuman and appear "successful" to nearly everyone around you. In fact, you just need one rule: What you do is more important than how you do everything else, and doing something well does not make it important
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Being overwhelmed is often as unproductive as doing nothing, and is far more unpleasant. Being selective – doing less – is the path of the productive
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: In the last 12 months, I’ve used deloading outside of sports to decrease my anxiety at least 50% while simultaneously doubling my income
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I alternate intense periods of batching similar tasks (recording podcasts, clearing the inbox, writing blog posts, handling accounting, etc.) with extended periods of – for lack of poetic description – unplugging and fucking around
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Great creative work isn’t possible if you’re trying to piece together 30 minutes here and 45 minutes there
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The idea is not to be idle. That’s not something that I advocate. It is to maximize your per hour output
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: People are poor judges of importance and inflate minutiae to fill time and feel important
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you spend your time, worth $20-25 per hour, doing something that someone else will do for $10 per hour, it’s simply a poor use of resources
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: By working only when you are most effective, life is both more productive and more enjoyable. It’s the perfect example of having your cake and eating it, too
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Large, uninterrupted block of time — 3-5 hours minimum — create the space needed to find and connect the dots. And one block per week isn’t enough
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: There has to be enough slack in the system for multi-day CPU-intensive synthesis. For me, this means at least 3-4 mornings per week where I am in "maker" mode until at least 1pm
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If I’m in reactive mode, maker mode is all but impossible. Email and texts of "We’re overcommitted but might be able to squeeze you in for $25K. Closing tomorrow. Interested?" are creative kryptonite
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I miss writing, creating, and working on bigger projects. YES to that means NO to any games of whack-a-mole
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The great "deloading" phase. This is what I’m experiencing this afternoon, and it makes a Tuesday feel like a lazy Sunday morning. This is when the muse is most likely to visit. I need to get back to the slack
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If you want to create or be anything lateral, bigger, better, or truly different, you need room to ask "what if?" without a conference call in 15 minutes. The aha moments rarely come from the incremental inbox-clearing mentality of, "Oh, fuck… I forgot to… Please remind me to… Shouldn’t I?… I must remember to…"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: There are certain things I will automate, but when it comes to quality control, I want to keep a very close eye
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What might you do to accomplish your 10-year goals in the next 6 months, if you had a gun against your head?

Doing less meaningless work, so that you can focus on things of greater personal importance, is not laziness. This is hard for most to accept, because our culture tends to reward personal sacrifice instead of personal productivity
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: In my mind, when I’m trying to deconstruct, let’s say a sport, all i’ll ask is to start with: "what rules are people following that are not required? (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)
People, even good people, will unknowingly abuse your time to the extent that you let them. Set good rules for all involved to minimize back-and-forth and meaningless communication
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I think time management as a label encourages people to view each 24-hour period as a slot in which they should pack as much as possible
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Believe it or not, it is not only possible to accomplish more by doing less, it is mandatory. Enter the world of elimination
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: "What if I did the opposite?": What if I only asked questions instead of pitching? What if I studied technical material, so I sounded like an engineer instead of a sales guy? What if I ended my emails with "I totally understand if you’re too busy to reply, and thank you for reading this far," instead of the usual "I look forward to your reply and speaking soon" presumptive BS? The experiments paid off. My last quarter in that job, I outsold the entire L.A. office of our biggest competitor, EMC
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: What you do is infinitely more important that how you do it. Efficiency is still important, but is useless unless applied to the right things
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Poisonous people do not deserve your time. To think otherwise is masochistic
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Pareto’s Law can be summarized as follows: 80% of the outputs result from 20% of the inputs
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: What 20% of customers/products/regions are producing 80% of the profit? What factors or shared characteristics might account for this?" Many such questions later, I began making changes: "firing" my highest-maintenance customers
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: What is the 20% of my belongings that I use 80% of the time? Eliminate the other 80% in clothing, magazines, books, and all else. Be ruthless – you can always repurchase things you can’t live without
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: On finding and working on the essentials: The 80/20 principle, also known as Pareto’s law, is the primary tool in this case. It dictates that 80% (or more) of your desired outcomes are the result of 20% (or less) of your activities and inputs
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: After reading The E-Myth Revisited by Michael Gerber and The 80/20 Principle by Richard Koch, I decided that extreme questions were the forcing function I needed. The question I found most helpful was, "If I could only work 2 hours per week on my business, what would I do?"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: If you had a gun to your head or contracted some horrible disease, and you had to limit work to 2 hours per week, what would you do to keep things afloat?

responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: When prioritizing his todo list: Which one of these, if done, would render all the rest either easier or completely irrelevant?
1. Limit tasks to the important to shorten work time (80/20). 2. Shorten work time to limit tasks to the important (Parkinson’s Law)
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Parkinson’s Law dictates that a task will swell in perceived importance and complexity in relation to the time allotted for its completion
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I tend to focus on the 80-20 analysis as it applies to people getting on and off the ground as quickly as possible to say be on top 5 to 10% of the general population
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: Invest in duplicating your few strong areas instead of fixing all of your weaknesses
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The decent method you follow is better than the perfect method you quit
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I value self-discipline, but creating systems that make it next to impossible to misbehave is more reliable than self-control
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If we’re talking about just distractions, we’re talking about prioritization. If you feel like you don’t have time, you don’t have priorities. Everyone has the same amount of time
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: It is imperative that you learn to ignore or redirect all information and interruptions that are irrelevant, unimportant, or unactionable. Most are all three
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: In a world of distraction and multitasking, the ability to single task — to genuinely do one thing without getting distracted by push notifications, alerts, email, text messages, social media, whatever it might be — is a super power
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The problem with New Year’s resolutions – and resolutions to ‘get in better shape’ in general, which are very amorphous – is that people try to adopt too many behavioral changes at once. It doesn’t work. I don’t care if you’re a world-class CEO – you’ll quit
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The end product of the shorter deadline is almost inevitably of equal or higher quality due to greater focus
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Indiscriminate action is a form of laziness
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Schedule things in advance, or you might be inclined to quit. A lot of standup comedians do this, because they may have six or 12 gigs before they do their first set well. Commit beforehand; prepay if you can
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: It’s hip to focus on getting things done, but it’s only possible once we remove the constant static and distraction
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Blaming idiots for interruptions is like blaming clowns for scaring children – they can’t help it. It’s their nature. Then again, I had, on occasion, been known to create interruptions out of thin air. If you’re anything like me, that makes us both occasional idiots. Learn to recognize and fight the interruption impulse. This is infinitely easier when you have a set of rules, responses, and routines to follow
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss
Tim Ferriss
responsibility.quote: What bullshit excuses do you have for not going after whatever it is that you want? (Conversation with BJ Miller)
My agenda became a list of everyone else’s agendas
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: No newspapers, magazines, audiobooks, or nonmusic radio. Music is permitted at all times. No news websites whatsoever (cnn.com, drudgereport.com, msn.com,10 etc.). No television at all, except for one hour of pleasure viewing each evening. No reading books, except for this book and one hour of fiction11 pleasure reading prior to bed. No web surfing at the desk unless it is necessary to complete a work task for that day. Necessary means necessary, not nice to have
responsibility.author: (Four Hour Work Week Low Information Diet)

responsibility.quote: The world doesn’t even hiccup, much less end, when you cut the information umbilical cord
responsibility.author: (About the low information diet)

responsibility.quote: I feel that the big ideas come from these periods [deloading phases]. It’s the silence between the notes that makes the music
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Create slack, as no one will give it to you. This is the only way to swim forward instead of treading water
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Once your life shifts from pitching outbound to defending against inbound, however, you have to ruthlessly say "no" as your default. Instead of throwing spears, you’re holding the shield
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: People don’t lose in various aspects of their lives because they pursue a lot of bad ideas. They lose because they say yes to too many ‘kinda cool’ things/ideas
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Doing less is not being lazy. Don’t give in to a culture that values personal sacrifice over personal productivity
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Being busy is most often used as a guise for avoiding the few critically important but uncomfortable actions
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: If I’m "busy," it is because I’ve made choices that put me in that position, so I’ve forbidden myself to reply to "How are you?" with "Busy." I have no right to complain. Instead, if I’m too busy, it’s a cue to reexamine my systems and rules
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I was once refused for a lunch date with a very famous tech investor and he said, ‘Sorry, I’m on a no-meeting diet for the next month and I have a policy of saying no to all meetings’. So I started using a ‘no conference call diet’ and people just rolled with it. It was incredible. There was no feedback, no push-back
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Saying yes to too much "cool" will bury you alive and render you a B-player, even if you have A-player skills
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: To develop your edge initially, you learn to set priorities; to maintain your edge, you need to defend against the priorities of others
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Once you reach a decent level of professional success, lack of opportunity won’t kill you. It’s drowning in 7-out-of-10 "cool" commitments that will sink the ship
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I hope you find the strength to say no when it matters most. I’m striving for the same, and only time will tell if I pull it off
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Alternating periods of activity and rest is necessary to survive, let alone thrive. Capacity, interest, and mental endurance all wax and wane. Plan accordingly
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Do not answer calls from unrecognized phone numbers. […] It just results in unwanted interruption and poor negotiating position. Let it go to voicemail and relax
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Do not e-mail first thing in the morning or last thing at night. The former scrambles your priorities and plans for the day, and the latter just gives you insomnia. E-mail can wait until 10am, after you’ve completed at least one of your critical to-do items
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Do not agree to meetings or calls with no clear agenda or end time
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Do not let people ramble. Forget "how’s it going?" when someone calls you. Stick with "what’s up?" or "I’m in the middle of getting something out, but what’s going on?" A big part of GTD is GTP — Getting To the Point
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Do not check e-mail constantly — "batch" and check at set times only. I belabor this point enough. Get off the cocaine pellet dispenser and focus on execution of your top to-do’s instead of responding to manufactured emergencies
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Do not over-communicate with low-profit, high-maintenance customers. There is no sure path to success, but the surest path to failure is trying to please everyone. Do an 80/20 analysis of your customer base in two ways–which 20% are producing 80%+ of my profit, and which 20% are consuming 80%+ of my time? Then put the loudest and least productive on autopilot by citing a change in company policies
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Do not work more to fix overwhelm — prioritize. If you don’t prioritize, everything seems urgent and important. If you define the single most important task for each day, almost nothing seems urgent or important
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Do not carry a cellphone. Take at least one day off of digital leashes per week. Turn them off or, better still, leave them in the garage or in the car. I do this on at least Saturday, and I recommend you leave the phone at home if you go out for dinner
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Do not expect work to fill a void that non-work relationships and activities should. Work is not all of life. Your co-workers shouldn’t be your only friends. Schedule life and defend it just as you would an important business meeting
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I meditate almost every morning for 20 minutes
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: More than 80% of the interviewees have some form of daily mindfulness or meditation practice
responsibility.author: (Tools Of Titans)

responsibility.quote: Q: What concept or method that you’ve learned from the experts on your show took the longest for you to implement into your life, or felt the most forced,that ended up having the biggest effect? Definitely meditation upon waking. I was very resistant to this, viewed it as "not for me," and misunderstood the techniques and results that could be achieved in even 1-2 weeks. Taking a Transcendental Meditation class and using Headspace for their "10 in 10" (10 min per day for 10 days) helped to solidify the habit and showed me that meditation can really just = emotional non-reactivity training. This translates to every interaction you have and can dramatically impact almost every area of life
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: So I received an email with a link to an article and the title is "Bridgewater founder, Ray Dalio credits transcendental meditation for his success". For those of you who don’t know, he’s the founder of the world’s largest hedge fund, Bridgewater Associates, they have a hundred billion plus under management I think. His quote is "Meditation, more than any other factors have been the secrets to whatever success i’ve had". And that is a hell of an endorsement
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: For me, it’s been getting over that resistance to what I perceived as sort of a "woo-woo new agey" type of thing and the ability to sort of view it as sort of a warm bath for the mind where I’m taking a mini vacation from my own brain in a way
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: I started meditating and gave up meditating many many times because I had the response that you mentioned about type A personalities
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: Learn to slow down. Get lost intentionally. Observe how you judge both yourself and those around you
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I’d be sitting there and I thought that the objective was to quiet my mind. And so when I failed at quieting my mind because I’d be ticking off the todo list or be like "ah that f*cker who said A, B and C to me the other day" and I would just like harp on these ridiculous things and then I’d get pissed and then I’d get pissed that I was pissed… and I would get up and have a cup of coffee and then storm out of the house which didn’t seem like a productive meditative sessions
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: I actually started doing it consistently when I kept it really short and a friend of mine recommended this where I would #1 be comfortable so I would sit down but to avoid back pain, I would lean against the wall, which is very commonly thought of as a big no no. So I was leaning against the wall to keep my back straight and I would listen to one music track, one song every morning, the same song as a cue and I would just pay attention to my breath. I would focus on being an observer of my thoughts but not trying to control them at all
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: All I did was think about my todo list the entire time, that’s fine, as long as I’m paying attention to my breath
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: That non-attachment to an outcome, i.e. controlling my thoughts, was very helpful
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: What I found was that by allowing the thoughts to occur and not judging myself because let’s say I’m thinking about email, or the grocery shopping and the todo or whatever, just letting that happen but getting good at observing it, I was able to then have more emotional awareness which would prevent cognitive biases and bad judgments
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: After meditating consistently for even a week or so, when that anger would start I was better at observing "Tim" as a 3rd person "Oh look at that, Tim is getting angry at something really small and stupid" as opposed to simply becoming angry and then causing problems for myself whether it was just internal or interacting with people
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Josh Waitzkin)

responsibility.quote: I’ve had this aversion to meditation. But when it’s very non-dogmatic, when you’re not trying to control anything, just think of a candle flame, just observe your thoughts and be okay with them. Sit with good posture for this period of time, that’s it
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Chase Jarvis)

responsibility.quote: The physiological or psychological effects are so fascinating, like you said, because you’ll do it for a couple of days and you’re like, whatever. Then you hit this sort of inflection point where you just drop from 200 RPMs to 150. You’re like, "Whoa. Okay. This is different". The whole week, you’re kind of zenned out
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Chase Jarvis)

responsibility.quote: It’s like this extended period of calm and ease in decision-making. Uncluttered, like you closed every browser on your computer and shut off the anti-virus, and rebooted the whole thing
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Chase Jarvis)

responsibility.quote: Even if it’s for ten minutes a day so that your not in a reactive mode. It’s really a game changer. Physiologically, it had a lot of effects for me as well. When my cortisol level dropped, I was able to lose body fat more easily in my abdomen, for instance
responsibility.author: (Conversation with Chase Jarvis)

responsibility.quote: Observe your thoughts, instead of being constantly the victim of your thoughts
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The first thing I would do for anyone who’s trying to lose body fat, for instance, would be to remove foods from the house that he or she would consume during lapses of self-control
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Now, it’s literally #1 (health). What does this mean? If I sleep poorly and have an early morning meeting, I’ll cancel the meeting last-minute if needed and catch up on sleep. If I’ve missed a workout and have a con-call coming up in 30 minutes? Same. Late-night birthday party with a close friend? Not unless I can sleep in the next morning
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Ours is a culture where we wear our ability to get by on very little sleep as a kind of badge of honor that symbolizes work ethic, or toughness, or some other virtue—but really, it’s a total profound failure of priorities and of self-respect
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: In practice, strictly making health #1 has real social and business ramifications. That’s a price I’ve realized I must be fine paying, or I could lose weeks or months to sickness or fatigue
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I would emphasize that by improving your physical machine, which includes the brain, you improve all of your performance, and the transfer is incredible to business
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Even if you are predisposed to being overweight, you’re not predestined to be fat
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: As long as you are keeping your blood-sugars in check, and your insulin levels in check, I think that the demonization of fat – including saturated fat – is completely unwarranted
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Nothing breaks my heart more than seeing that person who’s struggling to lose weight who thinks that they need to run 20 miles a week. They have no desire to do it, their knees hurt, they hate it, and they’re not losing weight. And I’d like to say, ‘Well, I’ve got great news for you. You don’t ever need to run another step a day in your life, because there’s no value in that.’ "There is value in exercise, though, and I think that the most important type of exercise, especially in terms of bang for your buck, is going to be really high-intensity, heavy strength training. Strength training aids everything from glucose disposal and metabolic health to mitochondrial density and orthopedic stability. That last one might not mean much when you’re a 30-something young buck, but when you’re in your 70s, that’s the difference between a broken hip and a walk in the park
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Hot baths can also significantly increase GH (growth hormones) over baseline, and both sauna and hot baths have been shown to cause a massive release in prolactin, which plays a role in wound healing
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I now take ~20-minute saune sessions post-workout or post-stretching at least four times per week, typically at roughly 160 to 170F. If nothing else, it seems to dramatically decrease DOMS (delayed-onset muscle soreness)
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Making health #1 50% of the time doesn’t work. It’s absolute — all or nothing. If it’s #1 50% of the time, you’ll compromise precisely when it’s most important
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: AcroYoga is something that I’m currently really delving into. It’s a combination of, in effect, yoga, acrobatics, and Cirque Du Soleil-type performances
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: On seeking ways to sleep better: That’s how I started reading fiction again. It really was to consume something that would actually push me away from problem solving and more into kind of fantasy dream mode. I was like alright, I’m not really a fiction reader but to fix my insomnia I’ll do it
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The advice I give for sustainable behavioral change, including diet, is that you make one change at a time
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Everyone is going to binge on a diet, for instance, so plan for it, schedule it, and contain the damage
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The Slow-Carb Diet succeeds where other diets fail for many reasons, but the biggest is this: It accepts default human behaviors versus trying to fix them. Rather than say "don’t cheat" or "you can no longer eat X," we plan weekly "cheat days" (usually Saturdays) in advance
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: People on diets will cheat regardless, so we mitigate the damage by pre-scheduling it and limiting it to 24 hours
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Outside of cheat days, slow carbers keep "domino foods" out of their homes. What are domino foods? Foods that could be acceptable if humans had strict portion control, but that are disallowed because practically none of us do
responsibility.author: Common domino foods include: Chickpeas, Peanut butter, Salted cashews, Alcohol

responsibility.quote: For me, startups are a domino food. In theory, "I’ll only do one deal a month" or "I’ll only do two deals a quarter" sound great, but I’ve literally NEVER seen it work for myself or any of my VC or angel friends
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I believed for a very long time as an athlete that low-fat, high-carbohydrate was an optimal diet. And I think there’s a decent amount of evidence, circumstantial or direct, to suggest that low-fat diets create a host of issues ranging from joint problems to amenorrhea, like the cessation of menstruation. I mean, I think entirely unnatural for sedentary people or for athletes
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Optimal meal, I would say, would be grass-fed steak with vegetables, maybe some lentils for fiber
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: On fasting: There is also evidence to suggest – skipping the scientific detail – that fasting of 3 days or longer can effectively ‘reboot’ your immune system via stem cell-based regeneration
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: On fasting: Fasting doesn’t need to make you miserable and weak. In fact, it can have quite the opposive effect
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: On fasting: I will regularly, three continuous days per month minimum, practice fasting. I will do that from early Thursday dinner to an early Sunday dinner to simply expose myself to the rather, often unfamiliar, sensation of real hunger
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I travel with boxes of sardines, oysters, and bulk macadamia nuts
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: On fasting: I now aim for a 3-day fast once per month and a 5 to 7-day fast once per quarter
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: On fasting: I allowed trace amounts of BCAAs and 300 to 500 calories of pure fat per day on my "fast"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The more you schedule and practice discomfort deliberately, the less unplanned discomfort will throw off your life and control your life
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Stoicism can help you to become a better, kinder person. In helping you to become less emotionally reactive (e.g., reflexively angry or annoyed), it helps you to better resolve conflict, and teach others to do the same
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Most losses or mistakes are really survivable
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: The best way to counter-attack a hater is to make it blatantly obvious that their attack has had no impact on you
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Don’t get angry, don’t get even – focus on living well and that will eat at them more than anything you can do
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I’ve heard it said before, I certainly didn’t come up with the expression, "Everything you want is just outside your comfort zone
responsibility.author: " Why don’t you proactively develop an ability to widen that comfort zone?

responsibility.quote: To do anything remotely interesting you need to train yourself to be effective at dealing with, responding to, even enjoying criticism
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Both Stoicism and Buddhism focus quite extensively on awareness of impermanence, so the practices are often complementary
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I view Stoicism not only as a means for greater effectiveness—which it certainly is — but also as a tool for creating a better, less divisive world. To quote Sam Harris, PhD, "No society in human history ever suffered because its people became too reasonable"
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: It’s possible to immediately "be tougher," starting with your next decision. Have trouble saying "no" to dessert? Be tougher. Make that your starting decision. Feeling winded? Take the stairs anyway. Ditto. It doesn’t matter how small or big you start. If you want to be tougher, be tougher
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Even if you only care about service to others, altruism, or being an instrument for good, to have the desired impact, you cannot be ruled by knee-jerk emotions, crying over spilt milk, and so on
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Practicing poverty or practicing rehearsing your worst case scenario in real life, not just journaling, not just in your head, I find very, very important
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: I expose myself to a lot of duress and pain in say, the form of ice baths and cold exposure simply to develop my tolerance for the then unavoidable pain and disruption that comes to all of us
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Simply reading Stoic passages in preparation for the day helps me to ideally, ignore, and when I cannot ignore, not respond to, certainly not engage with critics who have unfounded attacks
responsibility.author: Tim Ferriss

responsibility.quote: Getting a dog has made me a better person and a better Stoic. My pup Molly has no bad intentions when she does most "bad" things, for instance. As a puppy, she did what puppies do, of course: peed in the wrong places, chewed things up, disobeyed or ignored commands (mostly because I was unclear), etc.. She trained me to not overreact and get mad, which was pointless and actually made things worse for both of us
responsibility.author: (Question asked was "How has getting a dog changed your life?")
